urls.title: Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers 10 times greater than watchdog estimates
urls.description: In 2020 there were 160 breaches of Environment Agency permits to release sewage into rivers, UCL professor tells MPs

text: This was similar to the impression @stwater gave me: they say they don’t know how much sewage goes into our rivers and say it is @EnvAgency job to check. Not good enough >>>>Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers 10 times greater than watchdog estimates https://t.co/vmUizYeLTE

Cap it. Close it. Clean it up @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off #stopthestink 
@MattHancock @BorisJohnson @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/Txa0hBnU00

text: @lauraepolicy @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency Which @EnvAgency specific practices? It's a rather sweeping statement !  Yes - biological monitoring is preferable in many ways, but chemical sampling & analysis (of sediments/biota/effluents) has immense power to nail down pollutants and sources.
